alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 19 at 6:25PM EDT until June 19 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Western Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northwest of Kannapolis, or 5 miles north of Enochville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Landis around 630 PM EDT. China Grove around 650 PM EDT. Granite Quarry and Faith around 720 PM EDT. Salisbury and Spencer around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this dangerous thunderstorm include Mount Ulla and Piedmont Research Station. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
